meanings.definition: A member of the clergy in charge of a parish
meanings.sent1: The vicars in our town lead the church services every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The vicars worked hard to support and guide their parishioners.
meanings.sent3: The vicars organized a fun community event to bring everyone together.
meanings.sent4: The vicars were like shepherds, guiding their flock towards spiritual growth.
meanings.sent5: The vicars' presence in the parish was comforting and reassuring.

meanings.definition: A person acting as a representative or agent, typically in a religious context
meanings.sent1: The vicars from different churches gathered to discuss community outreach.
meanings.sent2: She acted as a vicars for her church when meeting with other religious leaders.
meanings.sent3: The vicars kindly offered to help organize the charity event.
meanings.sent4: He was a vicars of peace, spreading goodwill wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The vicars' words carried the weight of their faith and dedication.
